Hi Bert,

Thanks for your message, but we are not working with the Compaq F=
ortran compiler.
Probably you have send this message to a wrong address.

R=
egards

Alexey






  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Bert Bell 
  T=
o: cantera@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, May 22, 2007 7:00 PM
  Subject=
: RE: [cantera] Poblem in linking Compaq Visual Fortran with Cantera



  H=
ello:



  You need to build the Cantera interface library with your Fortra=
n compiler.  This library source also includes 2 C++ files so you will also=
 need a C/C++ compiler that works with your Fortran compiler.  I seem to re=
member that Visual Studion 6 works with the various Compaq Fortran 6.x vers=
ions. 



  The source is located in the zip under: 'cantera/Cantera/fortra=
n/src'





  R. F. (Bert) Bell

  Enginomix, LLC

  P.O. Box 850

  Menlo =
Park, CA 94026-0850

  (650) 289-0670 x2

  Fax: 859-201-7720


-----------=
-------------------------------------------------------------------

  From=
: cantera@yahoogroups.com [mailto:cantera@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Hes=
am
  Sent: Tuesday, May 22, 2007 2:07 AM
  To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
  Su=
bject: [cantera] Poblem in linking Compaq Visual Fortran with Cantera



  =
Hello all;
  I have seriously dealt with errors. I have download latest rel=
ease of 
  Cantera 1.7.0 (including windows installer (.msi) and its source=

  (.zip)). I've installed installer. But I really don't know how to set 
 =
 my Environmental Variables for Fortran application. I couldn't compile 
  =
demo.f90 when several errors such as "Could not find the file 
  cantera.mo=
d" appeared. Shall copy some specific files at specific 
  folders? Is it n=
ecessary to install python? (I've already installed 
  it!) Any useful docu=
ments on web?
  One moer thing is I have to write my progrm in Fortran90. S=
o i can't 
  use python, matlab or C++!
  Special thanks for your help!
  R=
egards, Hesam
